Martin Luther King Jr., a prominent civil rights activist, passed away peacefully in his sleep on April 4, 1968, in Atlanta, Georgia. He was at home resting after delivering a speech in support of local teachers demanding better pay. His passing marked a significant loss for the civil rights movement, leading to a surge in protests across the country.

How did Martin Luther King Jr. die and what impact did his death have?

ENDINSTRUCTION

Martin Luther King Jr. died on April 4, 1968, in Memphis, Tennessee, where he was assassinated. He was standing on the balcony of the Lorraine Motel when he was shot by James Earl Ray. His assassination led to riots and protests across the United States, and it had a significant impact on the civil rights movement. It highlighted the ongoing struggle for racial equality and justice, and it served as a catalyst for further activism and legislative change.
